14.50.text:
Today we are gonna be making a science themed
cake, we’re gonna be making a

18.81.text:
Beaker Cake. I got a lot of requests to do
something like this, so I’m really

22.77.text:
excited! It’s gonna get a little weird,
so let’s get weird with it!

30.23.text:
The things you will need, will be: Kabob sticks,
a bunch of Rice Krispies treats, you

37.19.text:
can bake your own from scratch, or I’ve
bought these ones pre-made from Kellogs.

42.23.text:
A little bowl, this is a glass bowl because
you can put it in the oven, it’s

46.79.text:
bake-able. And this is 1 quart or, uh, 950 milliliters,
so this is the size,

52.90.text: it’s pretty small. About dat big! A-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!

57.96.text:
And then you’re gonna need 3 eggs, I’m
using a box cake, you can use a pound cake

62.67.text:
or whatever cake you’d like, but I really
like this cake because it holds shape

65.99.text:
very well. A cup of water and 1/2 a sh-tick
of butter.

72.62.text:
I’m gonna be using my kitchenmaid to mix
all of these things up, but if you don’t

76.75.text:
have a stand mixer, you can just use an electric
hand mixer or a whisk.

81.77.text: You’ll just have to mix it around a lot!

84.09.text:
Alright, so the 1st thing I’m gonna do is pour
the cake mix, from the box cake,

89.36.text:
into the bowl. And then I’m gonna add my
1/2 a stick of butter, and you’re gonna

104.54.text:
A-boom! Now you’re gonna mix it all up until
it’s well combined.

108.51.text: Is it locked? Yeah, locked an loaded!

110.96.text: OH! Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, oh!

115.08.text: Mix it on a low speed and then a high speed!

118.14.text:
Now we’re gonna take our little bowl, and
I’m gonna take the leftover butter, and

123.46.text:
I’m just gonna smooth it around, all around
the bowl to grease the bowl,

127.52.text: so that this cake will pop out really easy.

130.33.text:
Now you’re gonna pour about 1/2 of your
batter into the bowl, it doesn’t have to

135.07.text: be exact, it will rise a lot when it’s baking.

138.48.text:
And we’re gonna bake 2 cakes, we’re gonna
bake 2 of these, so save

143.97.text:
Da-dew! There you have it, and now you’re
gonna heat your oven to 330, and we are

149.04.text:
gonna slow bake it, the reason I do this is
because it’s a very dense cake,

153.09.text:
so you don’t want it to burn. So you just
set it to 330, and then you bake it for

157.23.text:
about 28 minutes. But just keep your eye on
it, and you can use a toothpick to poke

162.34.text: it in and out of the cake, to see if its ready.

165.91.text:
Once both of your cakes are done baking, you’re
gonna remove them from the oven

169.61.text:
and allow them plenty of time to cool, because
if you do this while they’re still warm

176.18.text:
And now we are gonna shape them to look like
a science beaker.

180.38.text:
Look at these, they just… They, they baked…
Perfectly!

186.14.text:
So what I’ve got are 2 cardboard cake rounds
and I’ve just stacked them

190.14.text:
to be the height that I’ll need, and I used
a cake leveler set on the lowest setting.

195.54.text:
And then I’m just gonna walk it through
the cake so that my cake will by lying flat.

200.22.text:
And now we’re gonna do the same thing to
the other cake.

203.60.text:
Now that we have our 2 cake halves all leveled,
we are just gonna stack them.

208.90.text:
So I’m gonna put down the 1st one,
and then I’m gonna take my must-patula,

214.28.text:
and spread a little bit of buttercream frosting
in between, and then I’m gonna

219.59.text: stick on the top of the cake.

222.78.text:
Bottom of the beaker all done, now it’s
time to make the top.

227.18.text:
Now we are gonna make the neck of our beaker,
you’re gonna need 5 of these Rice

232.45.text:
Krispies Treats, and what we’re gonna do
is open all of them up and sculpt our neck.

238.00.text:
Now I’m gonna stack them, I’m gonna stack
them 2 and 2, and then stick these together.

244.44.text:
Rice Krispies are really, really sticky, and
I saw this on Cake Boss, where they

248.04.text:
mold things out of Rice Krispies, and it is
totally possible.

252.00.text:
So what you’re gonna do is press them together,
to get them to stick.

255.38.text:
And you’re just gonna keep doing this, working
it with your hands, until these little

260.24.text: Rice Krispies look like a tube.

262.44.text:
Boom! It’s done, OK I’m just gonna stick
this right here, and now I’m gonna take the

266.84.text:
5th Rice Krispie and I’m gonna roll it really,
really thin, to make the beaker lip.

276.08.text:
You’re just gonna wrap this around the top,
oh this is so funny!

282.08.text:
This molds really, really well, I’m really
impressed!

284.98.text:
Now we are gonna stabilize our beaker using
a kabob stick.

288.57.text:
So I’ve just taken 1 of the sticks, and
I’m gonna put it in here first.

292.15.text:
I’m gonna use the pointy end, and we’re
gonna put it up…

299.00.text: Now it is time to frost!

300.75.text:
I took a lot of Vanilla buttercream frosting,
I put it into a plastic bag,

306.07.text:
and I’m just gonna take a little scissors,
snip the tip, and now we are gonna

310.45.text:
frost this entire beaker cake. I put it on
a cake tray so that I could spin it around

314.66.text: making it a little bit more easy.

316.78.text:
This is a really easy cake, I would say that
it’s easy mode.

319.59.text:
We’re not doing any fondant, and you’re
just gonna take your must-patula, and

324.00.text:
spread the white frosting on as evenly as
you can.

327.38.text:
But if it’s not perfect, who cares! It’s
Science!

331.76.text: Well actually science is pretty... Accurate…

334.29.text:
A really good tip for the frosting is once
you’ve got it laid over your whole cake

338.36.text:
I put it in the freezer for 10 minutes to
chill. And then I ran the spatula all the

343.59.text:
way around it again. And it got really smooth,
look at that!

350.13.text:
Now we’re gonna take the blue buttercream
frosting, I’ve dyed it blue with a few

354.50.text:
drops of sky blue food coloring dye. I put
it in a plastic bag with a number 5 tip

360.70.text:
at the end, and we’re going to decorate
our beaker!

367.06.text:
Now I’m just gonna take this extra white
frosting I put it in a plastic baggie with

371.31.text:
a number 2 tip, and I’m just going to decorate
the side of the beaker with the

376.22.text:
milliliter measurements, starting with 50
and ending with 200.

382.75.text:
Here is our science beaker cake, it is so
cute, thanks you guys for suggesting it.

387.88.text:
I have never made with Rice Krispies, molded
a cake before, this was my first

392.47.text: time and it was really easy! I loved it!

395.07.text:
If you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

399.56.text:
leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen.

403.56.text:
Also, you can follow me on Twitter, Facebook,
Instagram or Tumblr!

408.01.text:
I’ll post lots of pictures of this cake,
and if you want to send me your creations,

413.59.text:
if you make any Nerdy Nummies, send them to
me and I like to post them, I just get

417.68.text: a big kick out of them.

446.66.text:
Did you guys watch that show? I watched that
show growing up…
